Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: porting Hush-NG, essentially rebranding the codebase with a few tweaks, for Pirate is looking very interesting. It allows sending and receiving messages via the memo field, which I think Pirate users would enjoy filling with bad pirate jokes

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: @dukeleto I deleted my crappy joke so that the honest question didn't get lost

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I am not used to honest questions. I usually look for interesting bounties and work on them if the reward sounds reasonable for the risk of trying to deliver the working code

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: just for my own curiosity, you might find that I rage-commit a Pirate-NG wallet (obviously needs a better name), and then let the community spruce it up with nice graphics/css/etc

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: Asked because I'm always intrigued by the fine balance of people don't know how much to offer and coders don't want to ask/announce for fear of people 😮 over what the work is actually worth

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: been too busy insulating water pipes and fixing Hush dpow, but it's bubbling up to the top of the list

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I have been rewarded generously for cryptocoin bounties, and I have also been screwed over a few times with really low-ball amounts for the work involved, which I usually decline but sometimes you can't resist

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and sometimes you spend dozens of hours to figure out if you can estimate how hard the whole project is, and it all ends in getting paid nothing. But that is not the case with this particular thing, Pirate gui wallet is comparatively easy, to say fixing weird KMD coredumps

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the ongoing maintenence of a gui wallet, constant updates and security fixes and ..., that is what is the biggest time sink for the dev

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
personal example:
I got offered x amount for a private stratum
To me, that was an insanely low amount for that much work
To him, that was incredibly high and "generous offer"

Content: yep, that sounds very familiar

Author: And1_89#6578
Content: is there a mining calculator?

Author: BlockTech#6895
Content: I don't think so ... not for now

Author: BlockTech#6895
Content: But quick math : --->>> Nbr of Pirate per day / Network Hashrate = Pirate per sol.      ---->>>  Pirate per sol * your sol/s = Your pirates earned per day (approximatively). ---->>>  Not 100% sure.

Author: BlockTech#6895
Content: with 1Ksol/s you get around 4 pirates a day with the currend Network Hashrate I think.

Author: BlockTech#6895
Content: For the electricity cost, just go : ---->>>   your consumption, * 24 / 1000 * your electricity cost per Kwh. -----> >>>  give you your daily electricity cost.

Author: BlockTech#6895
Content: Personnaly it cost me around 1,5$ (electricity ) mining with 2 GTX 1070  -> Give me around 3,8 pirates a day = ~ 0,5$  I'm probably gonna stop mining tomorrow ^^. (High electricity cost in my country.) @And1_89
